question: What is the designation of the highway that passes through Ak-Baital Pass?

evidence.fact: Set high in the Pamir Mountains, the road to the summit, also known as Pereval Akbaytal, is the defiant M41 road, informally and more commonly known as the Pamir Highway.
At 4,655 metres (15,272 ft) it is the highest point of the M41 highway.

question: What is the designation of the highway that passes through the highest point on the Pamir Highway?
parent_question: What is the designation of the highway that passes through Ak-Baital Pass?

evidence.fact: Set high in the Pamir Mountains, the road to the summit, also known as Pereval Akbaytal, is the defiant M41 road, informally and more commonly known as the Pamir Highway.
At 4,655 metres (15,272 ft) it is the highest point of the M41 highway.
At 4,655 metres (15,272 ft) it is the highest pass on the Pamir Highway.

question: What is the designation of the highway that passes through Ak-Baital Pass in Tajikistan, at an elevation of 4,655 meters (15,272 feet)?
parent_question: What is the designation of the highway that passes through the highest point on the Pamir Highway?

evidence.fact: Set high in the Pamir Mountains, the road to the summit, also known as Pereval Akbaytal, is the defiant M41 road, informally and more commonly known as the Pamir Highway.
At 4,655 metres (15,272 ft) it is the highest point of the M41 highway.
At 4,655 metres (15,272 ft) it is the highest pass on the Pamir Highway.

The Ak-Baital Pass (Kyrgyz: Акбайтал, romanized: Akbaytal; Tajik: Перевал Акбайтал, romanized: Pereval Akbaytal, Russian: Перевал Акбайтал) is a mountain pass in the Pamir Mountains in Tajikistan, on the M41 highway. At an elevation of 4,655 metres (15,272 ft) it is the highest point on the Pamir Highway, and the highest paved pass in the former Soviet Union.

At an elevation of 4,655 metres (15,272 ft) it is the highest point on the Pamir Highway, and the highest paved pass in the former Soviet Union.
The highest point of the Pamir Highway is Ak-Baytal Pass (4655 m).
